(a) Perform duties assigned by the Board of WPP plc to the best of his ability, but not to exceed the time and resources reasonably expected for a person in his position;
  (b) Accept offices or directorships as requested by the Company, however, he may decline if such commitment would significantly impede his other responsibilities;
  (c) Employ reasonable efforts to advance, safeguard, expand, and improve the business of the Company and any associated entities;
  (d) Adhere to all reasonable and lawful instructions given by the Board of WPP plc, but he may request clarification or explanation if necessary for his understanding;
  (e) Abide by all policies and procedures of the Company and/or the Group. The Executive is made aware, in general terms, of the Company’s data protection, anti-bribery and corruption, expenses, and Code of Conduct policies, but specific compliance with these policies remains his responsibility;
  (f) Comply with all requirements, recommendations, or regulations of any regulatory authority that pertains to his role or the Company or any relevant Group Company, however, he may seek guidance if unsure of compliance with a particular requirement;
  (g) Provide reports to the Board of WPP plc regarding the affairs of the Company or any Group Company when necessary, but he is not obligated to provide frequent or unnecessary updates;
  (h) Report his own misconduct and any known misconduct by other employees who report to him or directors of the Company or any Group Company only if the wrongdoing is material, serious, and likely to have significant impact on the business or reputation of the Company or a relevant Group Company, and only after consulting with legal counsel to ensure compliance with any reporting obligations and protections against retaliation;
  (i) Comply with the articles of association (as amended from time to time) of any Group Company where he serves as a director, but he may request reasonable accommodations if the requirements conflict with his other duties or responsibilities;
  (j) Perform statutory, fiduciary, and common law duties owed to the Company or any Group Company of which he is a director, but he may seek guidance if unsure of his obligations in a particular situation;
  (k) Take actions necessary to ensure compliance with the UK Corporate Governance Code of the UK Listing Authority (as amended from time to time), but he may request exceptions or waivers if strict adherence would cause undue hardship or harm to the Company or a relevant Group Company;
  (l) Comply with all requirements, recommendations, or regulations issued by the UK Listing Authority, the Market Abuse Regulation (596/2014/EU), the FCA and other regulatory authorities relevant to the Company or any Group Company, as well as any code of practice issued by the Company relating to dealing in the securities of the Company or any Group Company, but he may request clarification if unsure about compliance with a particular requirement or recommendation;
  (m) Comply with all applicable legislation and regulations on insider dealing, but he may seek guidance if uncertain about any specific provision or interpretation.

original: 8.3 The Executive has been grated Fixed Protection. The Company acknowledges that once the Executive has informed the Company that he has Fixed Protection, under Regulation 5D of the Occupational and Personal Pension Schemes (Automatic Enrolment) Regulations 2010 it does not need to automatically-enrol or automatically re-enrol  the Executive into a pension scheme. The Company therefore agrees not to enrol the Executive in the Plan or any other pension scheme at any time after the Executive has informed the Company that he has Fixed Protection 2016, The Company agrees in the meantime that it will not enrol the Executive into the Plan or any other pension scheme unless it is compelled to do so by law or the parties agree in writing otherwise. If the Company is compelled to enrol the Executive into the Plan or another pension scheme under law, or the Executive opts to join the Plan or any other pension scheme the Executive acknowledges and agrees that:
ollama_generated:
8.3 The Executive possesses Fixed Protection; however, the Company understands that once the Executive notifies the Company of this status, it is no longer required, under Regulation 5D of the Occupational and Personal Pension Schemes (Automatic Enrolment) Regulations 2010, to proactively enroll or re-enroll the Executive into a pension scheme. The Company, therefore, relinquishes its obligation to enroll the Executive in the Plan or any other pension scheme after the notification of Fixed Protection in 2016. The Company will abstain from enrolling the Executive into the Plan or any other pension scheme unless it is mandated by law or both parties mutually agree in writing.

In cases where the Company is compelled to enroll the Executive into a pension scheme under law, or if the Executive elects to join the Plan or another pension scheme, the Executive acknowledges and agrees that:

1) The Company bears no responsibility for any contributions or benefits accrued prior to the enrollment;
2) The Executive will be subject to the terms and conditions of the chosen pension scheme effective from the date of enrollment.
3) The Company holds no liability for any retroactive changes in the pension scheme's rules or regulations that may occur before the effective date of the Executive's enrollment.

original: Table of Contents (a) the Company has no liability to him if payment of any contribution to, or the provision of any benefit under, the Plan (whether by itself or when aggregated with any contribution to or any increase in value of the Executive’s rights under any other arrangement) gives rise to an annual allowance or lifetime allowance charge (within the meaning of the Finance Act 2004) and that the Company has no responsibility to make any enquiry or advise the Executive as to the possibility of any such charge; (b) he is liable for reporting and paying any such charge in accordance with the Finance Act 2004; and (c) the Company has no liability to him in respect of any loss for any reason of enhanced protection, fixed protection, fixed protection 2014, fixed protection 2016 or any similar protection allowed in future (for the purposes of the Finance Act 2004) if applicable to the Executive.

(a) The Executive acknowledges and accepts that no liability shall be borne by the Company, should the payment of any contribution to, or provision of any benefit under, the Plan (individually or in conjunction with any other arrangement) triggers an annual allowance or lifetime allowance charge (as defined by the Finance Act 2004). (b) The onus lies upon the Executive to identify and comply with any such charges, as well as their prompt reporting and payment, in accordance with the Finance Act 2004.
(c) In the event that enhanced protection, fixed protection, fixed protection 2014, fixed protection 2016, or any similar protections under the Finance Act 2004 (if applicable to the Executive) result in a loss, the Company shall not be held liable. The responsibility for such losses falls solely on the Executive.

original: 10.3 If the Executive is absent due to illness for more than one month, the Board shall be entitled at any time thereafter to appoint an executive director or employee to perform the Executive’s duties and to exercise his powers until the Executive is able to resume his duties, following which such substitute will cease to act in the Executive’s role.
ollama_generated: 10.3 In the event that the Executive is unable to fulfill their duties due to prolonged illness exceeding one month, the Executive shall have the option, upon providing written notice to the Board, to temporarily delegate their responsibilities and powers to a designated executive director or employee appointed by the Board. The Executive shall remain responsible for all actions taken during this temporary delegation period and shall resume their duties as soon as they are able to do so. If no such notice is provided, the Board may, at its discretion, appoint an interim executive director or employee to perform the Executive's duties and exercise their powers during the Executive's absence. Upon the Executive's return, the interim appointee will continue in their role unless the Executive exercises their right to resume their responsibilities.

original: 13. CONFIDENTIAL INFORMATION 13.1 In this clause 13, Confidential Information  means information (whether or not recorded in documentary form, or stored on any magnetic or optical disk or memory) relating, without limitation, to the business, clients, customers, products, affairs and finances of the Company or any Group Company for the time being confidential to the Company or any Group Company or in relation to which the Company or any Group Company is subject to a duty of confidentiality and trade secrets including, without limitation, technical data and know-how  relating to the business of the Company or any Group Company or of any persons having dealings with the Company or any Group Company, whether or not such information (if it is not in oral form) is marked confidential, and includes, without limitation:
ollama_generated:
13. CONFIDENTIALITY OBLIGATIONS
13.1 In this clause 13, Confidential Matters shall refer to information (in any format or medium), whether or not it is labeled as confidential, that pertains, but not limited to, the business, clients, customers, products, operations, and financial matters of the Company or any Affiliate, for which the disclosing party maintains a duty of confidentiality, and may include technical data, proprietary know-how, and trade secrets. Such Confidential Matters extend to information concerning any persons interacting with the Company or its Affiliates. The Receiving Party acknowledges and agrees that it shall keep all such Confidential Matters confidential and not disclose them to third parties unless required by law. In such cases where disclosure is necessary, the Receiving Party shall provide prior notice to the Disclosing Party to allow for appropriate protective measures.

Exceptions to this permission must be approved by the Board in advance, either directly or indirectly.

original: (a) in the reasonable opinion of the Board fails or neglects efficiently and diligently to discharge his duties, including, without limitation his duties under Chapter 2 of part 10 of the Companies Act 2006, or is guilty of any serious or repeated material breach of his obligations under this Agreement and, if that material breach is remediable, fails to remedy the breach within a period of 21 days after being notified in writing to do so; (b) is guilty of any fraud, dishonesty, serious misconduct or any other conduct which, in the reasonable opinion of the Board, brings or is likely to bring the Executive or the Company or Table of Contents any Group Company into disrepute or affects or is likely to affect prejudicially the interests of the Company or the Group; (c) is convicted of an arrestable offence (other than a road traffic offence for which a non-custodial  penalty is imposed); (d) is guilty of any material breach or material non-observance  of any code of conduct, requirement, rule or regulation referred to in sub clause 3.2; (e) becomes bankrupt or makes any arrangement or composition with his creditors; (f) is prohibited from being a director by law; (g) resigns as a director without the Company’s prior consent; (h) has become physically or mentally incapable of acting as a director and may remain so for more than six months, according to a written opinion issued in relation to the Executive to the Company from a registered medical practitioner who is treating the Executive; or (i) is not or ceases to be eligible to work in the UK, the Company may by written notice to the Executive terminate this Agreement with immediate effect.
ollama_generated:
(a) In the reasonable judgment of the Board, the Executive persistently or significantly underperforms or fails to promptly and effectively fulfill his duties, including but not limited to those outlined in Chapter 2 of part 10 of the Companies Act 2006, or breaches any significant or recurring material terms of this Agreement, and if such breach can be rectified, does not take corrective action within a 21-day period following written notification to do so.
   (b) The Executive engages in any act of fraud, dishonesty, severe misconduct, or any behavior that, in the reasonable judgment of the Board, may harm or could potentially damage the Executive, the Company, or any associated Group Company's reputation, or acts in a manner that negatively impacts or could potentially adversely affect the Company or the Group's interests.
   (c) The Executive is arrested for an offense other than a traffic violation where a non-imprisonment penalty is imposed.
   (d) The Executive violates any significant provision or disregards any essential requirement, rule, or regulation mentioned in sub clause 3.2 of this Agreement related to a code of conduct.
   (e) The Executive declares bankruptcy or reaches an agreement with creditors.
   (f) The Executive is legally barred from serving as a director.
   (g) The Company withdraws its consent for the Executive's resignation as a director.
   (h) The Executive, due to physical or mental incapacity, is unable to perform his duties for more than six months, according to a written opinion issued by a registered medical practitioner treating the Executive and submitted to the Company.
   (i) The Executive is no longer eligible to work in the UK; or (j) at any time without the prior written consent of the Company, the Executive ceases to be employed by any Group Company, the Company may terminate this Agreement immediately upon providing written notice to the Executive.

original: 17. OFFICE AS A DIRECTOR 17.1 Any office or directorship which the Executive holds in any Group Company is subject to the articles of association of the relevant company from time to time.

EXECUTIVE'S ROLES IN GROUP COMPANIES - 17.1 The Executive's offices or directorships within any Group Company shall not be restricted by the articles of association of the relevant company, unless specifically provided otherwise in writing and signed by an authorized representative of the respective company.

This clause allows for a bit more flexibility in the Executive's roles within the Group Companies, as it removes the automatic applicability of the articles of association, unless explicitly specified otherwise. This could potentially allow for more freedom in decision-making or management structures, but still maintains the requirement for written consent if there are any specific restrictions to be applied.
